entry.title: First smoke test after SAP LogServ solution deployment in Microsoft Sentinel - Part 0
entry.content:
Find your way to our central blog series entry here.

Dear community,

Due to the asynchronous integration between SAP LogServ and Microsoft Sentinel, it's advisable to perform a smoke test yourself before sharing your config data with SAP. This helps confirm if your receiving connector setup works and ensures the correct configuration will be shared with SAP the first time round.

 

Run a smoke test for ease of mind

Once the SAP LogServ push-connector is deployed on Microsoft Sentinel, you can start posting data towards its data collection endpoint. Use the provided REST client collection, or scripts to replicate the exact requests details that LogServ is performing too.

Maintain the variables as per your environment, see the LogServ sample payload and start posting. A working request shows http code 204 with no content on the response. See a sample output from the provided powershell script for reference. I prefer REST clients but people are different üòé

 

Find the parameters from the SAP LogServ Sentinel connector wizard on initial connect (see screenshot below). You can also get them directly from the individual resources. The data collection endpoint and data collection rule are created in the same resource group as your Log Analytics workspace underpinning Sentinel. They are prefixed with ‚ÄúSAPLogServ‚Äù. The app registration on Entra ID can be found from the Entra Application ID field.

 

Use the 2 KQL queries below to inspect your first data entry on the SAPLogServ_CL table in Sentinel.

SAPLogServ_CL
| take 10
SAPLogServ_CL
| summarize count() by clz_dir, clz_subdir
| order by clz_dir asc, clz_subdir asc

 

Wait a minute or two on first try. The population of new tables takes a short time initially.

Alternatively, deploy the SAP LogServ insights workbook on Sentinel for visual oversight. 

 

Once saved to your workspace, start looking for the smoke test result. It covers all your observabilty needs going forward.

 

Hurray you have a functioning data collection endpoint for the SAP LogServ dataüéâ

Now, continue your onboarding journey by sharing the config data with SAP over your chosen channel. Find the details on SAP's blog here.

What if you don‚Äôt see the data entry on the LogServ table?

  1. Verify the connection details: Did you really hit the right endpoint? Are you looking in the right tenant and log analytics workspace?
  2. Verify selection criteria: Is your Time range filter accurate? The smoke tests create entries for NOW or 30mins earlier in UTC.
  3. Did enough time pass on the initial table population? Consider a retry of the KQL query.
  4. Verify the Data collection rule has not been changed to filter all results or similar. See this blog part and KQL snippet for more details.

 

Deployment fully messed up?

The simplest way to a fresh start is a delete and redeployment of the Log Analytics workspace. In case that is not an option you need to delete the LogServ connector resources to reset the LogServ solution in Sentinel. The data collection endpoint, data collection rule and entra id app registration can be deleted from the Azure portal. But the data connector itself needs to be deleted via API.

For your convenience, use this REST API request collection to drop the resources. Once performed the LogServ connector UI will activate the deploy button again. In case you went fully bazooka and also deleted the SAPLogServ_CL table from your Log Analytics worksapce that needs to be reverted too. If the table had data you need to run a restore operation from Azure CLI.

 

Final Words

That‚Äôs a wrapüåØ. You saw today how to streamline your onboarding experience of SAP LogServ in Microsoft Sentinel. Simple smoke tests ensure a speedy onboarding and confidence in the shared setup configuration.

#Kudos to @Hemanth_Kusampudi and team for the partnership.

Get started with your deployment from here today.

Cheers Martin

entry.title: AI Features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023 FSP03
entry.content:
In this blog post, let's delve into the innovations delivered with Feature Pack Stack 03 for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, which was released in March 2025. We will focus on the cutting-edge innovations powered by artificial intelligence, revolutionizing how businesses operate and thrive. For an in-depth overview of the release, check out the latest update from our expert @Harish_Mangtani and his blog on this Cloud ERP solution.

The recent release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition introduces over 300 innovations, further enhancing capabilities across diverse business lines and industries. Key highlights include:

  • 200+ Innovations for Lines of Business
  • 60+ Innovations for Industry-Specific Needs
  • Numerous Localization and Cross-Topic Improvements

 

Join us as we explore how these innovations, especially in artificial intelligence, are setting new benchmarks in digital transformation, enabling businesses to harness data-driven insights for optimized decision-making and strategic growth.

Don‚Äôt miss this quick video that highlights some key innovations showcased in this post.

Please note that the following video was produced with Synthesia, a new platform that allows users to create videos featuring a digital twin of yourself and even includes a personal AI-generated Voice for an authentic touch.

  • Faster access to updates ‚Äì Videos are created more frequently, so you're always getting the latest and most accurate information
  • Engaging and accessible ‚Äì Short, to-the-point videos
  • More inclusive ‚Äì Videos include subtitles and can be consumed in multiple languages

 

Watch now and let us know what you think in the comments!

Product Highlights

As enterprises look towards the future, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 2023 FPS03 leads the charge with seven groundbreaking AI innovations. These advancements are designed to streamline operations, enhance financial accuracy, and optimize resource management, setting the stage for effective and sustainable business transformation.

1. AI-Assisted Journal Uploads

Finance departments can now leverage generative AI for journal uploads, automating the creation and validation processes. By assigning guidance documents and automatically generating posting proposals, businesses ensure accuracy and compliance. This allows financial professionals to pivot their focus towards strategic financial planning, supported by a reliable audit trail. 

 

 

 

2. AI-Assisted In-House Service Initiation
Repair processing becomes seamless with AI extracting vital data from scanned documents. The system reads these documents, proposes necessary repairs, and reduces manual efforts significantly. Automated identification of equipment further enhances efficiency, offering a higher degree of accuracy and reducing the likelihood of errors in repair processing.

 


3. Joule-Enabled Mass Modification of Sales Orders

Sales Order Management sees significant enhancement using Joule's Copilot capabilities. Performing mass changes to sales orders is now faster and more efficient, as users can update multiple orders simultaneously by applying a simple command. This innovation minimizes the need for manual updates and enhances overall efficiency in sales order management.

 


4. AI-Based Explanation Assistant for Detailed Scheduling

For production planning, the AI-based Explanation Assistant offers clear insights into scheduling results. It provides real-time feedback and detailed summaries, enabling production planners to understand and trust the outcomes of the Detailed Scheduling Optimizer. This enhances transparency and ensures smooth operations, driving efficiency in production environments.

 

5. Project System Support with Joule Copilot Capabilities

Project management is revolutionized with Joule's new project assistant capabilities. Project system users can now access instant data and status updates using everyday language queries, eliminating the need for complex navigation in multiple systems. This innovation streamlines data consolidation, providing a comprehensive overview of a project‚Äôs progress with ease.

 

6. Joule-Enhanced Search for Bills of Materials

Selective Joule scenarios enhance exploration capabilities within Bills of Materials. Users can utilize simple, natural language queries to search product data efficiently. This is particularly beneficial for R&D engineers and change coordinators, enabling cost-effective product lifecycle management and increased flexibility in change-record operations.

 

7. Intelligent Vehicle Assignment in Automotive Management

In automotive vehicle management, intelligent assignment capabilities ensure optimal matching between vehicle configurations and sales orders. The intuitive app streamlines inventory management by optimizing vehicle assignments and facilitates swaps or unassignments efficiently, improving the overall processing speed.

 

For more details on the innovations mentioned, watch the video and use the chapter markers to skip directly to the topics you're most interested in.

Summary and what to do next

As you can see, we have a lot to offer, very much based on feedback of clients running their business on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

entry.title: Against all odds ‚Äì Integrated Supplier on the SAP Business Network ...
entry.content:
Against all odds ‚Äì OQEMA AG managed to integrate the S/4HANA Cloud, private edition with the SAP Business Network (integration scenario scope item 4A1) and successfully went live with the pilot market

Introduction

OQEMA AG has been an integrated (system-to-system integration) supplier on the SAP Ariba Network (now called SBN) since 2019, leveraging the so-called Business Suite Add-on (BSAO).

It‚Äôs no coincidence, that in the same year, DSAG and SAP launched an initiative to jointly develop a successor solution for the BSAO. In September 2019, as part of this initiative, the DSAG submitted a list of BSAO deficiencies/shortcomings to SAP. This list was then compiled and prioritized by the member companies of the DSAG Ariba Working Group (beginning of April 2020) and identified several must-have requirements, out of which one has been the need for "Provide an approval workflow for order inbound changes." It may sound a minor requirement, but it's probably a key must-have for most customers, as a simple change to the order on the customer (buyer) side can lead to inconsistent changes to the sales order on the supplier side with corresponding business disruptions in the downstream process.

An example: The customer orders product A for delivery date X. The sales order is created and processed on the supplier side. Typically, an outbound delivery is created with a certain lead time. From this point on, the delivery date can no longer be changed (the delivery would have to be deleted). However, the customer (buyer) can submit an order change (update) at any time and, for example, adjust the desired delivery date. Due to an integration error, the supplier does not check whether the delivery date can still be changed at all. Instead, the date is "simply" changed. This problem already existed in the previous integration with SAP ECC. However, there was at least the option to detect and prevent this situation using a customer-specific extension (BAdI). The new solution does not offer a corresponding extension option. The idea behind "Provide an approval workflow for order inbound changes" would not only solve this problem but also improve the process, giving both parties visibility in case of changes to the purchase order.

At the end of February 2022, SAP approached us and asked us to create an influence request, which would be required for the implementation of the solution. This influence request, dated March 1, 2022, has now received 43 votes.

Subsequently, the initiative worked together on the design of the solution. In 2024, a user experience test was successfully conducted with several companies using a PoC.

And now? We're now in 2025, and SAP still hasn‚Äôt been able to confirm any release date for the solution. We can only speculate about the reasons for this, and yes, they may be diverse. However, one important aspect could be the "chicken and egg" problem. Since 2023, there has been a code split between the SAP S/4HANA public cloud and the on-premises/private cloud.

4A1, the scope item that succeeds BSAO, has been generally available (GA) since the S/4HANA 2020 release, but adoption appears to have been low, especially in the public cloud (although not limited to this environment) - not really surprising, isn‚Äôt it?

Without adoption, there's no priority and no development resources ‚Äì without improvements, there's no adoption. A dilemma!

Our challenge

We at OQEMA AG knew that we would need to replace our existing integration with SAP SBN and say goodbye ‚Äì both to our ECC and to the BSAO. But how can we achieve this if the ‚Äúproduct‚Äù has functional gaps and there is no real commitment to solve them?

Our way

We had some support from SAP (huge thanks to those who always supported us and believed in us) and many many creative workarounds on our end. In May 2025 we successfully went live with our pilot scenario. Currently, we have integrated the order-in and order-confirmation process for direct material with SAP S/4HANA, private cloud release 2023 FPS1.

What‚Äôs next?

Trying to do the same magic for the advanced shipping notification and invoice integration and paving the way to finally say goodbye to SAP ECC & BSAO!

And you?

We are curious how other suppliers managed to integrate their SAP S/4HANA backend system with the SBN. Are you already on S/4HANA or is your transformation project still ongoing? Who is also using the standard integration that comes with scope item 4A1? Please reach out to team-up and influence SAP‚Äôs product roadmap.

entry.title: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì Creating a Fiori tile for ABAP reports
entry.content:
TL;DR ‚Äì How to create a tile on the SAP Fiori launchpad to run an ABAP report ‚Äì based on customer experiences. This is a gap-filling technique that is useful for moving existing custom ABAP reports in system conversion projects, or where an SAP predefined report is missing from the SAP Fiori apps reference library.   Alternatives are given at the end of the blog post..

You have an existing ABAP report that you want to run from the SAP Fiori launchpad.  How do you create a tile to run an ABAP report? In the example in this blog post you will see how you can create a tile using the predefined transaction SA38. This is a simple 3-step approach for a sandbox environment. For a development environment, you should consider creating a custom transaction. You will find a brief discussion at the end of this blog post in section Alternative approaches to consider.

 

Creating a tile from scratch is a 3-step process:

  1. Define the tile to launch the ABAP report.
  2. Reference the tile definition into your custom business role for the user.
  3. Adjust the role‚Äôs menu and authorizations for any authorizations needed to run the ABAP report.

Once you test your tile you can consider optional Next Steps.

Why create a tile for an ABAP report?

When transitioning from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition, you're shifting from using SAP GUI to the SAP Fiori launchpad. This change lets you take advantage of new features offered by RISE with SAP S/4HANA via SAP Fiori apps. You've identified these new functionalities using tools like SAP Signavio. Refer to SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA - Finding business process improvements with SAP Signavio

Due to time and budget constraints, it's often not feasible to convert all existing user interfaces into SAP Fiori apps. You want to avoid creating a mixed experience for users; instead, you want them to access all applications‚Äîboth new and old‚Äîfrom a single platform.

The SAP Fiori launchpad enables you to integrate classic UIs, including GUI Transactions, Web Dynpro ABAP applications, WebClient UIs, and ABAP Reports. Many SAP GUI transactions and ABAP Reports are already available in the SAP Fiori apps reference library by filtering on All Apps for SAP S/4HANA.

However, custom ABAP "Z" reports and some SAP predefined ABAP reports, like batch-scheduled ones, may not be listed. For these situations, you might need to manually create a tile in the SAP Fiori launchpad.

Hints:

  • Refer to SAP Help - SAP Fiori launchpad - Administration Guide for how to create a tile for any GUI transaction. 
  • If you are not familiar with the terms technical catalog, business catalog, business role, or Launchpad App Descriptor Item (LADI), you can find these explained in the SAP Help ‚Äì SAP Fiori launchpad ‚Äì Administration Guide ‚Äì Setting up Launchpad Content ‚Äì About Launchpad Content
  • All screenshots shown on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS03 system.  This same process can be used on SAP S/4HANA 2020 or higher.

P.s. If you are wondering why not just use the SAP Menu or User Menu feature in the App Finder, refer to my previous blog post 

SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì How to include GUI transactions in the launchpad ‚Äì User Menu versus Catalogs

 

Example Use Case

For customers using Project and Portfolio Management, it can be helpful to extend project roles such as Project Financial Controller (technical id SAP_BR_PROJ_FIN_CONTROLLER) with some additional ABAP reports that are not yet included in the SAP Fiori apps reference library.  

For example, report /RPM/FICO_INT_PLANNING_V2 is an ABAP report that can be scheduled, or optionally run manually. To run the report manually you want a tile on the SAP Fiori launchpad. You use this report to control when and how data from SAP Financials and Controlling (FI-CO) is a applied to projects managed by Portfolio and Project Management. 

Pro-tip: To verify your ABAP Report will run successfully on the SAP Fiori launchpad there are a couple of pre-checks you can do. 

  1. Run the ABAP Report in WebGUI. For example, using the direct WebGUI URL for your system's host and port such as:  http://<host>:<port>/sap/bc/gui/sap/its/webgui?~transaction=SA38
  2. If there any issues with any of the features of your report, check the WebGUI restrictions and limitations for your release to make sure you are NOT using a feature that will not work in a web browser. For SAP S/4HANA 2023 this is SAP Note 3417085 - 7.93: SAP GUI for HTML functionality / Limitations / Sp. Behaviour
  3. Worst case: If the ABAP Report is not web-browser ready - and this is rare - then review section Alternative approaches to consider.

 

Prerequisites

Assumptions:

  • Your SAP Fiori launchpad for SAP S/4HANA is already configured and active. If this has not been done, refer to Learning Video - Activating SAP Fiori Launchpad Using SAP Fiori Foundation Task List

You will need to know:

  • The ABAP report id.  This could be a SAP predefined ABAP report or a custom ABAP report.
  • The technical catalog that will hold the tile definition.
  • The business catalog that will hold the reference to the tile definition.
  • Which business role contains the business catalog.
  • A test user id assigned to the business role that will contain the tile.
  • 1 cross-client workbench transport request
  • 1 client-specific customizing transport request
  • Package Id for your launchpad content.

Pro-tip: It's helpful to keep all SAP Fiori launchpad content in the same package.

For the example use case:

  • Custom technical catalog Z_TC_PROJ_FIN_EXTRA has been created to hold custom apps for Project Financials.
  • Custom business catalog Z_BC_PROJ_FIN_PORTFOLIO has been created to collect custom apps for Project Finance ‚Äì Portfolio Management
  • The business catalog Z_BC_PROJ_FIN_PORTFOLIO has already been assigned to custom business role Z_BR_PROJ_FIN_CONTROLLER.

You will need access to Fiori launchpad content administration tools including:

  • Launchpad App Manager
  • Launchpad Content Manager Client-Specific
  • Role Maintenance (transaction PFCG)
  • Report execution transaction SA38

Hint: For this example, the Fiori Administration role (id Z_FIORI_FOUNDATION_ADMIN) has been used. This business role is generated by task list SAP_FIORI_FOUNDATION_S4. Refer to Learning Video - Activating SAP Fiori Launchpad Using SAP Fiori Foundation Task List generated by task list SAP_FIORI_FOUNDATION_S4. Authorizations to execute transactions PFCG and PFCGUPDATEROLEMENU were added to the admin role. In practice, the role maintenance tasks would be run by a security administrator user.

Step 1 ‚Äì Define the tile for the ABAP Report

First you need to define the tile for the SAP Fiori launchpad.

  • You define the tile by creating Launchpad App Descriptor Item (LADI). A LADI contains the tile definition that defines how the tile should appear, and the target mapping that defines which app is launched when the tile is selected in the launchpad.  
  • You define the tile once, and then later you reference the tile to one or more business roles. You typically define the tile in your Sandbox or Development system, then transport the changes to subsequent systems in your landscape as needed.
  • LADIs are created within cross-client technical catalogs. Because technical catalogs are cross-client, you will use a Workbench Transport Request to capture your changes ready for transport. Refer to SAP Help ‚Äì SAP Fiori launchpad ‚Äì Administration Guide ‚Äì Setting up launchpad content - Setting Up Technical Catalogs with the SAP Fiori Launchpad App Manager

Login as your Fiori launchpad content administrator.

Open the Launchpad App Manager.

On the tab Technical Catalogs, find and open the technical catalog that will contain the LADI definition.

Hint: You can optionally create a new standard catalog using the button New Standard Catalog on the same tab.

Select the option Add App > Transaction to add a new LADI for a transaction.

You will be asked to confirm the Package and Workbench Transport Request to capture your changes to the technical catalog.

For the field Transaction Code, enter SAP GUI transaction SA38.

Pro-tip: You should use transaction SA38 for business users executing reports. To avoid unnecessary authorizations being generated, do NOT use transaction SE38 which should only be used by developers who create reports.

Press the <ENTER> key. This will default in some information from SE93 such as:

  • Device Type settings
  • Application Component id
  • Default tile name

Adjust the following settings in tab Target Application Fields:

  • Semantic Object ‚Äì use the closest SAP Semantic object that fits with the main business object of the report.  For the example, because the report is run for project portfolios, the standard semantic object ProjectPortfolio is selected.
  • Action ‚Äì The action for the Semantic Object is freely definable. Enter a camel case verb that fits with purpose of the report. Action is set to integrateFICO4Planning
  • Target Application Title ‚Äì this is the link text that is shown whenever the app is displayed as a link, e.g. in Search Results, Related Apps, and List of Links dialogs. For the example use case, Target Application Title is set to Portfolio - Financial Periodic Planning and Integration.
  • Application Component ID ‚Äì this is the support component shown in the About and App Support dialogs to indicate where to search on SAP for Me for information. For the example, Application Component ID is set to PPM-PFM.

Pro-tip: There are more than 3K Semantic Objects delivered by SAP, with predefined dynamic navigation links to related launchpad contact, including any additional custom tiles you create. Avoid creating custom Semantic Objects as these are not linked to any existing apps, making it harder for users to navigate between apps.

Add the following parameters in tab Parameters:

  • Program ‚Äì set Default Value to your program id, and set Rename To value  RS38M-PROGRAMM
  • DynproNoFirstScreen  - set Default Value = 1
  • DYNP-OKCODE  - set Default Value = STRT to start the report

To complete the definition, you adjust the tile appearance in the tab Tiles.

Adjust the following settings in tab Tiles:

  • Tile texts - Title, Subtitle, and Information
  • Tile Keywords ‚Äì these are used to help find the tile when using Search on Apps
  • Tile icon ‚Äì you can use the value help to search for suitable icons

Select Save to save your LADI.

Step 2 ‚Äì Assign the tile definition to the business role

Launchpad content items ‚Äì such as apps - are directly assigned to business catalogs, and indirectly assigned to business roles. Business catalogs typically contain a small subset of closely related apps that are assigned together to one (or more) business roles.  Business catalogs and business roles are client-specific.  

Open the Launchpad Content Manager ‚Äì Client-Specific.

On the tab Catalogs, find and open the business catalog that will reference the LADI.

  • You can use an existing business catalog, or you can select Create to create a new business catalog.
  • If you create a new business catalog you will need to assign the business catalog to the business role. 

Find and add the LADI to the business catalog using the option Add Tiles/Target Mappings > Add Tile/TMs to selected catalog.

Find your LADI add reference it to your business catalog by selecting Add Tile/TM Reference.

Confirm the LADI has been added to your business catalog.

To check which roles use this business catalog, select Show Usage in Roles.

 

Step 3 ‚Äì Adjust the business role content and authorizations

You now need to adjust the related business role's content and authorizations.  The easiest way to do this is to use transaction PFCGUPDATEROLEMENU. This transaction runs program PRGN_COMPARE_ROLE_MENU.  You can also adjust the role manually in Role Maintenance transaction PFCG.

Run transaction PFCGUPDATEROLEMENU for the related business role(s).

Any mismatches with the current role content are highlighted by the traffic light in the first column.

Select the mismatched row(s). Adjust the role menu by selecting Adapt Menu.

Press Refresh to review the corrected role content.  Correcting the role content impacts the role's authorization status, which needs to be adjusted for the change in content.

Select Change Role to review and adjust the changes in the role's authorizations. 

Find the new entries for Authorization Object S_PROGRAM in class BC_C. These grant authorization to run the program. 

Adjust the authorization program setting the program id. Set authorization field P_PROGRAM to the program you want the user to run.

Adjust the activities so that the user can run the report. Set authorization field P_ACTION to SUBMIT.  Pro-tip: You can also set VARIANT if you want the user to save variants to minimize data entry. 

Generate the role to update the profile.

Confirm the authorizations profile status is now generated.

Pro-tip: If you want to use the changes immediately you may need to run a User Comparison in the Role Maintenance transaction PFCG. This updates the cache that holds the user's current authorizations. 

Review the User tab.  Make sure your test user is assigned to the role. Run the User Comparison for your test user.

Test your tile

You can now use your test user to test your tile from SAP Fiori launchpad using the App Finder.

Select the tile using your business catalog title or any part of the keywords or tile texts.

Select the tile to launch the report.

Next steps ‚Äì consider where to place your tile

Once you are satisfied the tile is working, you can decide where to place it to help the user find it during their day-to-day work.  For example, you can add the tile to any Page assigned to any of the role‚Äôs spaces.

You can find which space is assigned to your business role using either:

  • Launchpad Content Manager ‚Äì Client Specific - tab Roles - option Show Spaces
  • Overview of Role, Spaces and Pages (transaction /UI2/RSP_LIST)

Refer to SAP Help ‚Äì SAP Fiori launchpad ‚Äì Administration Guide ‚Äì Analyzing Spaces and Pages

Worth knowing: You maintain spaces in app F4834 Manage Launchpad Spaces. You maintain the related pages in app F4512 Manage Launchpad Pages.  Refer to Learning Video - Creating SAP Fiori Launchpad Layouts for Custom Business Roles.

 

Alternative approaches to consider

For improved usage tracking and role maintenance

Instead of using transaction SA38, you can define a custom transaction for your ABAP report id.  Using a custom transaction enables you to track the usage of this app by transaction code.  It can also be useful for the security administrator.  For example, from Role Maintenance (transaction PFCG) they can search for the custom transaction across all security roles.

You can define custom transactions in transaction SE93.  For example, you could define a report transaction or a parameter transaction.

  • Instead of entering the parameters in the LADI, you enter the parameters in the custom transaction.
  • Mark your transaction as suitable for SAP GUI for HTML so that others know you have already checked all its features work from the SAP Fiori launchpad. 
  • You then use your custom transaction to create your LADI and complete the changes to the business catalog and business role as explained above.

Refer to: SAP Help - ABAP Platform - ABAP Workbench Tools - Maintaining Transactions

For improved report design and behaviour

Consider updating your ABAP reports to newer versions that are optimized for cloud use and mobile devices. If a report is hard to use, lacks information, or could be improved with visuals, consider redesigning it for a better experience.

For example:

You might consider replacing it with a SAP Fiori elements app,  for example, using the floorplans List Report or Analytical List Page. Refer to SAP Design Guidelines.

  • Pro-tip: Make sure your developers are up-to-date with the latest recommended programming models such as Fiori Elements Flexible Programming Model Explorer and ABAP RESTful Programming Model.

Or you might consider replacing it with a SAP Analytics Cloud story, if you want to combine information from SAP S/4HANA and another solution. Refer to Learning Journey - Designing Stories in SAP Analytics Cloud.

Becoming a SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA guru

You‚Äôll find much more on our  SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA topic page

entry.title: SAP Continuous Influence Session for SAP S/4HANA Utilities: Status Update July 2025
entry.content:
Two years ago, we have started our SAP Continuous Influence session for SAP S/4HANA Utilities. Since July 2023 it has been our single channel for collecting your suggestions for improvements related to SAP S/4HANA Utilities:

For more details, read my previous blog post New SAP Continuous Influence session for SAP S/4HANA Utilities.

On the occasion of the second birthday of our session, I am pleased to present a status update:

As of  10 July 2025, we have received a total of 101 improvement requests (IR) in our session:

22 IRs have already been delivered since the session started. Here is a list of the 9 IRs delivered during the last twelve months, starting with those that have received most votes:

  • IR 339315 - Weitere Suchfelder in der Verbrauchsstellen√ºbersicht (Customer Engagement/ IC Agent) werden ben√∂tigt 
  • IR 341395 - Updating (refresh) of an environment in Customer Engagement to the first level 
  • IR 321271 - BAPI_ISUPROFILE_IMPORT: EDM Import Application log  
  • IR 313649 - Profilevalue status handling in formula variables 
  • IR 331220 - IS-U billing: change the determined finale billing date 
  • IR 338268 - EA40: no customer screen for CI fields of table ERDK
